Program' Series Proposal
Mental health, like physical health, is closely related to the longer life
and the many pressures which grow out of our industrialized society. The three
series proposed here are all therefore in a sense functions of each other and very
closely related.
NAEB members have already done a certain amount of work in this area. The

earliest programs on the NAEB Radio Network.
There havs been later efforts in this direction by other NAEB stations as
well. One of those which might best suggest the format and technique visualized
for this series was done a few years ago by the University of Minnesota’s Station

quested by responsible and interested groups.
However, most of our member stations have not, without financial assistance,
been able to devote the time, personnel and budget to this area which it^deserves.
For such programs require a great deal of each.
Radio will still offer many advantages over television in this type of
project, particularly in the extent to which it makes possible the preservation
of the anonymity of persons interviewed. Also visual realism in clinical sit¬
uations which would be used are sometimes far more unpleasant than only aural
recordings with the tape editing and simple montage effects which can be provided in
